Hey @mtotschnig ,
first of all, I really love this app. I think it's the most complete and yet simple expense tracker, that is also open source.

Nevertheless I have a little suggestion:
Mabye you know the Software YNAB (You Need A Budget). The big point in this expense tracker is, that you assign every expense to a budget. So they basically have budget categories (similar like the current categories in your app) and each of these categories have a limit. So at the start of the month you think about how much money you want to spend on clothes, set this as a limit and go with it. You are always able to see, how much you are over or before the limit. It's important, that you can change budgets on the fly, if something changes (for example your pc breaks and you need a new one right now). There are also yearly budgets (holiday, presents, ...). The last important thing is, that when you set your budgets, the sum of all of them should be the income of your last month (minus potential savings).

title: Make transactions entered before 12:00 visible again
body:
With the possibility to hide the date field on the transaction form, the following problem was introduced: Transactions are created with the time set to 12:00. Since the current balance ignores transactions from the future, transactions added before 12:00 are not reflected immediately.
Two solutions:
1) Transactions are created with current time.
2) Current balance includes transactions until the end of the day.

1 is the easier, maybe more natural solution. But, the idea of the original design of creating all transactions at 12:00 was that transactions would more easily stay at the same day if the user switches timezones. But probably this is not that important.

title: Export produces invalid CSVs
label: [Label(name="roadmap_vote")]
body:
CSV exporting uses semicolon ";" delimiters, which is [non-standard](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4180) and should not be used. CSVs (_comma_ separated value files) should always use comma "," delimiters.

Seems to be handled in [`myExpenses/src/main/java/org/totschnig/myexpenses/export/Exporter.java`](https://github.com/mtotschnig/MyExpenses/blob/master/myExpenses/src/main/java/org/totschnig/myexpenses/export/Exporter.java#L136-L303).

How it currently exports:

```
"Something";"A Column";"Untitled"
"100";"John Doe";"Gas money, I think."
```

How it should export:

```
"Something","A Column","Untitled"
"100","John Doe","Gas money, I think."
```

title: Hide reconciled transactions instead of deleting them
label: [Label(name="roadmap_vote")]
body:
Currently the "Balance account" allows to delete reconciled transactions. User might want to keep them available for later consultation, but still hide them from the current list.
I can see three approaches to implement this user story:
1) Reconciled transactions could be marked as void. Then they would not be counted, but still be visible, and could be hidden by using the Status filter.
2) A user option could allow to toggle visibility of reconciled transactions.
3) Introduction of a new concept of "Archive" (Implementation details still open). When a user enters the archive (or one of multiple archives ?), the transactions in the archive would be shown and the current list hidden.

Other ideas?

body:
# Greetings

Hello, MyExpenses community!

I represent a team of MSIT-SE students from Innopolis University (Innopolis, Russian Federation).
Our Master's program includes a course named 'Methods: Deciding what to Design'. 

In this course we have a team project. The main idea of the project is to learn how to work with product requirements.
At the beginning of the project we got several tasks:

1. Find an open-source Android project.
2. Find potential customer for this project.
3. Define with customer features to be added, modified and removed from the project.
4. Implement these features.
5. Present our results to the customer and the application community.


All members of our team like the idea of financial management. And we thought that our experience could be useful for you.
And, as you can see, we chose MyExpenses application. 


We have almost completed the work on this project, and want to demonstrate you our results.
It would be great, if you will provide us some feadback about changes that we made. 
Or, maybe, you will find something interesting or useful, and include these features in the future versions of MyExpenses.


# MyExpenses CHANGELOG

## New features

1. Welcome slides with short description about main application features.
2. Currencies screen with a current exchange rate.
3. SMS-parsing for a quickly tracking from the debit/credit cards.
4. Find banks near your and show its' working state. 
5. Notifications not to forget to track expenses.

## Modifications
1. Main application screen
	1.1. Simplify design of transaction list.
	1.2. Redesign of Accounts sidebar.
	1.3. Updates in Application menu.
2. Statistics page
	2.1. Redesign (layout, styles, charts settings).
	2.2. Ability to switch between accounts on statistics page.
3. Interaction with categories
	3.1. Lock ability not to select category of transaction.
	3.2. Restructure categories (change type and remove dublicates).


## Removed features
1. Export/import to QIF format. 
QIF format is used by Microsoft Money. But this service/application is not supported now.
2. Print.
As practice shows, this feature is not used by mobile application users. It is more relevant for the desktop users.
3. Tell a friend.
This function is not often used. The most popular case is recommendations and high rating in Google Play.

title: Protect against change in currency definition provided by Android/Java
body: Currently My Expenses is vulnerable if a device is upgrade to a new OS version where the definition of the fraction digits used for a currency changes, as has happened recently for HUF. The result is that amounts get corrupted (multiplied or divided by 10^n, n being the difference between old and new definition). The best solution is probably to cache this definition for every currency in use, and we would be able to stick to the cached definition, when the system definition changes.

title: Projects
label: [Label(name="roadmap_vote")]
body:
Financial transactions are happening in the context of projects, and My Expenses should allow to manage this link.
Different implementations are possible:
1) Projects are handled as more or less independent sets of data, and user switches between projects as he would switch between files in a desktop program.
2) Projects are stored in a separate table that user can manage, linked to the transactions table and handled through an additional field in the form. User can filter on projects and generate reports based on projects.
3) There is no special support for projects, but implementation of #142 would allow to express them as tags.

Please comment, if you want to help decide on which strategy will bring most benefit to users.

title: optimized qif format for gnucash
body:
Für den Import in gnucash sollte das qif output Format optimiert werden.
Denn gnucash kann mit der Notiz zu einem Buchungssatz nichts anfangen, Der wird beim Import einfach ignoriert.
Gebe ich z.B. als Empfänger "Deutsche Bahn" an und vermerke in der Notiz die Reise, taucht diese in gnucash nicht mehr auf.

Bisher sieht der output so aus:
D11/07/2012
T-49,80
MFahrt nach Frankfurt
LFahrtkosten : Fahrtkosten
PDeutsche Bahn

durch eine Einstellungsmöglichkeit, sagen wir "gnucash import" in den Einstellungen könnte doch der Buchungssatz anders geschrieben werden.

z.B.
D11/07/2012
T-49.80
LFahrtkosten : Fahrtkosten
PDeutsche Bahn - Fahrt nach Frankfurt 
Also, die Notiz hinter den Empfänger

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////7
For the import in gnucash the "qif" output format should be optimized.
Because gnucash can not deal with the note in the record. It will simply be ignored during import.
If I give e.g. as a receiver "Deutsche Bahn" and put the destination into the notes field, this will not be shown in gnucash.

So far, the output looks like this:
D11/07/2012
T-49,80
MFahrt nach Frankfurt
LFahrtkosten : Fahrtkosten
PDeutsche Bahn

by providing a new menu entry, lets say "gnucash import" in the preferences menu, the new record could look like

D11/07/2012
T-49.80
LFahrtkosten : Fahrtkosten
PDeutsche Bahn - Fahrt nach Frankfurt 

So, the note behind the receiver

title: Allow negative initial value for an account
body:
I use MyExpenses to track my credit card payments.

As this is a monthly debited credit card, the virtual account I use for that is always negative. But as I can't key a negative value as initial value, I am not aware of the total amount of payments I'm affording.

Work around: I enter a  first operation to reach the negative amount of my account, then reinitialize and erase the generated extract.

title: Default payment method
body: When export data to Grisbi all payments become Credit Card . It's very annoying to modify that. Payments should be Direct Debit by default. And it should be fixed before implementing related feature "Payment methods" (issue #8)

title: Categories management from settings
body:
As it is possible to manage payees from the settings, it would be nice to have access to categories management from the settings.

Today we have to simulate the creation of a payment to add or remove categories and sub-categories

title: Move transaction from one account to another
body:
suggested by Lauco74: when you erroneously enter a transaction into the wrong account, it would be nice to be able to move it to the correct account.
Will be part of next minor release.

title: Sorting payees to ease removal
body: When willing to remove a payee, the list is not sorted and it may be difficult to find the payees to remove.

title: GrisbiImport use SAX instead of DOM
body:
Currently, the GrisbiImport uses DOM. Since users are encouraged to simply import their unmodified Grisbi file, which can be very large, this can easily lead to an OutOfMemoryError.
SAX should be used instead.

title: summary text and button labels in preference activity cut off
body: The summary text for the "Import from Grisbi" entry is cut off at least  in German locale in portrait orientation. The same for the button label "Categories and partners"

title: ftp upload does not handle screen orientation change
body: Changing screen orientation during ftp upload currently leads to crash, need to apply the same approach as in Grisbi Import AsyncTask

title: Make input format for amounts configurable
body: A user reports that on the Samsung Galaxy Note the , sign is missing from the keyboard. Thus making it cumbersome to input values.He suggests to allow input of cents values. A general solution might be to allow users to override the input format defined by its locale and input define his own format with or without comma separator

title: Crash when importing categories with italian locale
body: in the italian strings.xml the value for grisbi_import_categories_and_parties_success and grisbi_import_categories_success use 'd' specifier, but getString is called with String values. Thus when importing categories with italian locale, Myexpenses crashed. Need to use 's' specifier

title: Name of file qif on SD card
body: It would be interesting to have the name of the account with the date and time as filename for the qif file instead of the generic name of expenses with date and time. title: Webview cache behaviour
body: The webview that renders the tutorial caches the documents with no apparent possibility to renew the cache. It might make sense to provide a refresh menu action.

title: Import payee from Grisbi XML
body: It should be possible to populate the list of payees with the information found in a Grisbi XML file.

title: Make Order of categories configurable
body: Reported by a user: Currently categories are sorted by usages. This is not obvious to users, and some might prefer alphabetical sorting.

title: Make creation of operation easier
body: Reported by a user: Since creating new operations is the most important user interaction, this functionality should be accessible readily from the expenses list.

title: Make change of account easier
body: Reported by a user: Currently three clicks are necessary to change the current account. There should be a way to change it by one single UI action.

title: Payment methods
body:
Even without being able to export the payment method into the QIF file, I think it makes sense to add payment method as a data field to the interface. The following methods could be predefined and translated to the supported locales:
Cash
Cheque
Credit card
Deposit
Debit
Users will be able to define additional methods
A new transaction should have the last payment method used with the current account preset.

The app icon could also be replaced by one that is neutral with respect to currency. The current one is €-centric.

title: Bug on Locale

body: Après avoir créé une opération avec un montant supérieur à 1000 et si l'on cherche à corriger l'opération, l'erreur de format de nombre apparait. Cela oblige à revenir sur le montant pour enlever l'espace des milliers (testé en français). Solution : lors de l'édition de l'opération : remettre en format type anglais "1234.56" pour l'entrée du montant. De plus cela évitera d'avoir à changer de clavier pour aller récupérer la virgule des formats nécessitant celle-ci.
